website_summaries.verdict: Easy-to-use epoxy resin that carries a really nice price point versus some others.
pros: Needs a 1:1 mix, which simplifies using the product
Features a UV-resistant formula, which resists yellowing and provides long-lasting protection
Versatile product that works nicely for a wide variety of coating needs
cons: May not cure properly on all surfaces, creating a coating that's not as durable as others

customer_reviews.title: Ruined my project
customer_reviews.text: Ordered from them many times but after I received a bad batch company refused to replace product despite having filmed and documented the entire mixing process. Pro Marine removed me from their Facebook page when other users were coming forward with similar issue. I cannot afford to chance bad product on my work with a company that cannot back up their product. Will not be purchasing from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Pharris

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This product was easy to use and had very little odor. I used it as a final finish on my art projects and also with my resin art. Clear and hard finish.
customer_reviews.author: Scrappygirl

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful finish, beware heavy coating of first layer!
customer_reviews.text: Provided a beautiful finish on our bar. Take note to ALWAYS brush on a THIN for the first coat to seal the wood. The instructions arent too clear on this until you get to the FAQ. I had to sand down an area that bubbled up due to pouring too thick of a first coat.
customer_reviews.author: Henslee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect glitter table top
customer_reviews.text: Just finished my first project working with this, i mixed glitter in it and poured over the table top. Such an amazing and unique piece, the glitter is floating in different levels in the epoxy and the surface is super smooth and shiny. My advice, mix well, do it on a HOT day indoors, work fast use a heat gun for the bubbles/cloudyness
customer_reviews.author: hine0108

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use 1 to 1 ratio. Used for a live edge river table. Wanted to make sure it was strong enough and clear enough. Looks great. Some photos from a test piece attached. When I sanded with 220 grit sand paper, the resin looked very cloudy, but the next coat cleared it up. Tips: 1. Mix thoroughly 2. Use a torch or heat gun for the bubbles a couple of times after you pour it 3. Make sure your project is level 4. Do 2-3 skim/seal coats over wood to seal it 5. Give it enough time to set in a warm enough environment
customer_reviews.author: Michael Walker

customer_reviews.title: Makes for a great countertop!
customer_reviews.text: This did a great job on our countertops. Mixed it for five minutes for 32oz batch. No soft spots or stickiness. I used a high density foam roller to apply this to a painted countertop and a roller is the way to go rather than using a foam brush. You should let it sit about 16 hours before you touch it. Give it 24 hours before you sit any thing on the epoxy and say 36 hours before you put any thing heavy on it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Ashcraft

customer_reviews.title: Was not clear at all I've used epoxy many times ...
customer_reviews.text: Was not clear at all I've used epoxy many times and always bought the stuff from Lowe's and it's crystal clear I bought two gallons of this thinking I could save a little money and ruined a customers bar it will have to be sanded off and redone with a quality epoxy
customer_reviews.author: zach aastrup

customer_reviews.title: YELLOW!!! not clear
customer_reviews.text: Turns yellow after a few weeks!!! Beware: EVERYTHING I have used this on turns a yellowish brown within weeks after curing. Not clear like other brand I have bought
customer_reviews.author: Chihuahua Mama

customer_reviews.title: Measuring by Weight instead of Volume
customer_reviews.text: For those of you who would like to measure by weight instead of by volume it is important to know that Parts A and B do NOT have the same density. Therefore, here are the ratios you will need if you are using weight: For every 1 oz volume of Part A is equal to 33 grams of weight. For every 1 oz volume of Part B the weight is 27 grams of weight. The benefit of using weight instead of volume is that you may use only one container, rather than 3, which makes the process of mixing go faster.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew S.

customer_reviews.title: Transparent, but not colorless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was advertised as "crystal clear." To me, that means clear and colorless. In reality, the cured resin has a very obvious yellow tint (see photo of some leftover resin that cured in the clear plastic cup I was using) and will be useless for the projects I had in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Finke

customer_reviews.title: May yellow
customer_reviews.text: I use this brand to create resin art. It's the cheapest I can find and good quality. Not giving it 5 stars because it does yellow in the sun if you use white with it. I think most epoxy resins do this, but not all. I'm fine using this and keeping my products away from UV light. I prefer to use measuring cups to mix it 1:1. Once the extra in the measuring cup has hardened, you can peel it right off! Have fun! Here are photos of sun damage:
customer_reviews.author: SDA

customer_reviews.title: Would NOT Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: First of all they didn’t send any directions but I went online and watched several YouTube videos before use. I mixed it for about 10-15 minutes, using both of the half gallon parts so the ratio was 1:1. The mix started yellowing and hardening before I could even get it all on the counters. This was expensive so I’m definitely trying to get my money back and I wouldn’t recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: AmyRick

customer_reviews.title: Way too soft to be on a table
customer_reviews.text: Bought this from all the 4-5 star review. Completely disappointed with this product. Followed the directions on mixing and covering the table, let the table cure for 7 days and just putting a drinking glass and a soup bowl down left a mark, even the place mat left micro scratches. Not sure how this can be a bar table top. This is way to soft for a bar table top, for art maybe since its nice and clear.
customer_reviews.author: Tim T

customer_reviews.title: Not so good...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to do about a 1/4 inch coat, over some reclaimed wood. It's overly viscous which makes mixing difficult and despite heating it with a torch, there were tons of tiny little air bubbles.
customer_reviews.author: William Kilmartin

customer_reviews.title: Will not dry
customer_reviews.text: Mixed the whole container six days ago (4/3-4/9) and applied to a desk I was building. It's still not dry. Will update if it ever does dry.
customer_reviews.author: Annonymous

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: After using a different brand twice and being unhappy with the finished product, my husband tried this and loved it. He said the key is to start with very thin layers (as instructed). He used it on top of old barn wood and the final product looks professional and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: SpedAisd

customer_reviews.title: Nice clear thick surface for embedded countertops.
customer_reviews.text: The product itself worked well, but make sure if you are pouring it over something loose that they are are reasonably dense. I used on coffee beans and they floated before it cured. kind of a cool effect, but not what I really wanted. but that is my fault not the product. It cured nice and hard, clear and smooth on the areas where the beans had been stuck down first. Make sure to monitor for bubbles as they appear continually as it cures, I used a torch to lightly heat, it worked pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Lind

customer_reviews.title: Greatly disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I had problems with fisheyes that were deep and would not go away. I made sure the epoxy was 75 degrees,mixed correctly and surface prepared correctly and clean. I had to sand this down and start over and finally stripped it all off and simple used polyurethane. I tried a torch and a heat gun and the fish eyes just kept coming back on each coat. I have watched many youtube videos on epoxy coating bars, this did not perform at all like anything in the videos. I did not give up easily I made 3 attempts. Each time same result.
customer_reviews.author: Revuta Giesbrecht

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because it was cheaper than Art Resin. I used it to seal and coat ceramic tiles and wood pieces that I had painted with acrylic paint. The sealing of the containers is awkward and very difficult to manage. One orange top ended up inside of the bottle and blocked the opening anytime I tried to pour. The directions state that you must use two pours while mixing, which I did, but as anyone knows who has worked with resin, each time you pour you lose product. So, by pouring twice, more product is wasted. At this cost, I don't like having to waste any amount. The product has not dried yet although it looks clear.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Cotter

customer_reviews.title: Worst epoxy ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered one set and used it as directed from the pro marine supply website and it didn’t set correctly instead it stayed tacky. When I called to ask about it was very rudely told that I must not have done it correctly and to throw away the $500 price of wood seeing it was so tacky I couldn’t remove the old one. Stupid me I used the same brand a second time and this time it didn’t self level and left brush stokes in the epoxy and looks terrible. Don’t learn the hard way like I did and throw tons of money to this rude company that has terrible customer service and just use something else.
customer_reviews.author: Honest reviews

customer_reviews.title: Volumes not even
customer_reviews.text: This product is designed to be mixed at a very very precise 1:1 ratio, meaning the hardener and the epoxy jugs should contain precisely the same amount of product. Any discrepancies in quantities will be a cost absorbed by you the customer. As other reviews have stated, the quantities are off. There's about 1 more centimeter of hardener than there is epoxy. I'd estimate that to be maybe 1/4-1/3 a cup of hardener that will go to waste(at your cost). It also increases the chances of measuring errors. Don't base your measurements on how much product is left in each jug.
customer_reviews.author: Speerdo

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We were very hesitant in using this product as we were on sure how it worked? Upon reading the instructions and using YouTube we were able to determine the best use of this product! I do wish the directions were a little more detail on the bottle. Otherwise we are very pleased with this product and we would order again! Job well done.
customer_reviews.author: LoveMySevenLittles-Az

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Used this to create a beer cap table for our son. Worked out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Holly T.

customer_reviews.title: Read the directions for beautiful results
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing! If you're patient and can follow directions, you'll have no problem having an awesome counter or bar top. I poured one flood coat without filling reading the tips from the manufacturers website and wound up having to drill out the crazy amount of bubbles and sand it. The second pour I used the website instructions and was extremely patient and everything turned out great!
customer_reviews.author: Chris C

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR RESIN CRAFTS
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I have tried lots of craft resins and was recommended this as a bulk option for my crafts (i make resin ashtrays and rolling trays along with keychains ) and usually have no issue but this resin as given me nothing but issues. It gets too hot too fast, it doesn’t cure sometimes, i’ll mix and mix and theres tons of bubbles if you dont mix, it ripped my molds now i gotta buy more molds, If you are a crafter, i say pass on this brand and try another. Will try to finish these bottles the best i can but so far every project has been trash with this resin.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: We don't do tables, but we do use a lot of this.
customer_reviews.text: As a custom knife maker I use lots of Epoxys and resins to do everything from making knife handles to securing parts and components. This is great option for our needs for 2 reasons - 1.) Easy mixing 1:1 ratio means you can use pumps without having to buy the expensive pre calibrated ratio pumps. 2.) Clear resin is easily tinted and colored for our custom applications. Other pros: Good work / cure times, mixes easily, Has good gravity, and viscosity for forming and molding. Cons: holds bubbles a little long sometimes (could be due to atmospherics here though) Overall Good vendor with good product and follows up on customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Redneck Knifeworks

customer_reviews.title: Great for art projects, jewelry. Very forgiving compared to other epoxy resins.
customer_reviews.text: My mother and I use this resin to create art and jewelry. It mixes easily and is very forgiving (with EasyCast, for example, if your mixture is even little off the result never fully cures, with Pro Marine Supplies you don't need to be so precise). I have yet to have any project come out sticky - they always cure hard and smooth. There are some issues getting the resin to adhere to parts of a canvas (we do acrylic pours with silicone) that have more silicone than other parts, but this is to be expected of any resin.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy, bubbles won’t go away
customer_reviews.text: I am not happy with the quality of this resin at all. The only good thing about it is that it cures faster than other resins but it is not crystal clear at all. Your finished product will be yellowish and it will have millions of tiny bubbles in it, no matter how much you use your torch. Also, you will have a limited time (15-20 minutes) to work with it otherwise it will get gooey. I won’t be ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: MsNaab

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money..
customer_reviews.text: I have a flexible table! I'm so mad I bought 4 gallons... I waited 4 days [almost 5] to take out the frame... I noticed slight flexing... so I let it set today I'd say 8 days after.. its IT'S HIGHLY FLEXIBLE... I mixed every drop correctly... Let it set its appropriate time.. and still its wobbly .... I so un happy ..what a waste of money time and energy
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect a great job unless you follow directions.
customer_reviews.text: I have varnished wood for quite a number of years, applying countless coats to get that "look". This product really gives one the perfect coat of clear epoxy covering, however, please read the directions, and TAKE YOUR TIME. Granted one doesn't hurry applying varnish, but this product gives one time to correct any imperfections, but once it sets, it's set. My first project was covering a dining room table. I had thought I had leveled the table, not....this product will seek the lowest point. Several thinner coats later, I was able to level the entire coat out. It worked well, and is very durable. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst crap I have ever used. Regardless of how I applied this epoxy whether it was thin or a little bit thicker whether I use my gloved hand or silicone spatula whether I have the air conditioner on or the air conditional off...every single time it left fish eyes!!! And yes, my room was always around d 77 degrees. This stuff sucks ass!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful finish. A year later on one floor, no changes in color or surface finish.
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous coating for a pebble rock shower floor. Have done two so far. Just remember to plug your shower drain before yoy apply, as it is self-leveling and flows to the lowest points. One would think it would create a slick foor, but it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Custome

customer_reviews.title: Epoxy countertop not perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I followed the instructions to a T. I even waited for the temps to rise in the high 70's low 80's, low humidity. I did a seal coat as well as 2 flood coats. I ended up with small surface imperfections on both flood coats. The last coat is much better but not perfect. There are small surface dimples and waves. I'm assuming the product didn't self level, after hand spreading it to even height on counter. The amount of product on the coat was plenty for it to level. I'm going to try another brand before attempting on a table top.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: This product has a very long (if at all) curing time.
customer_reviews.text: I make orgonite. I've never (not even close) had trouble like I've had with this product. This product would not harden. I've had pieces sitting for days waiting for it to solidify instead of acting like Gumby. Sometimes, it doesn't ever set up. It's inexpensive but not worth it. Waiting for it to set up on a table top must take months. I won't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: jwincrawfordCo

customer_reviews.title: Poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: I mixed it 50/50 and the stuff never dries. The company said to scrape off the epoxy, but that would ruin the project. I mixed a 1/2 gallon at a time, and it started to get real hot and harden before I could use it all. The epoxy I put down was sticky after 4-5 days. So, I guess I wasted 65 dollars and have to start over!
customer_reviews.author: tesla

customer_reviews.title: 1 Reservation, fantastic otherwise
customer_reviews.text: Going the DIY for a bartop or counter, this stuff works great. If you follow their guide, one thin coat to seal the wood, the next applied liberally to coat everything like plastic. Get a heat gun or hair dryer ready for that second coat. Also seal any cracks, I had a few small gaps and the epoxy fell through during every coat. The only issue I had was that the first 2 times I stirred a batch there were virtually no bubbles but the third batch(3 days later) had a ton. I think once you get air in the bottles you need to use it up as fast as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Manelski

customer_reviews.title: Best quality and quanity from wonderful company
customer_reviews.text: I made a mistake n didnt mix properly n ruiend a gallon of resin I thought the resin was old but it was me not the resin they kindless shipped me out a replacent as a curticy and I was able to make the most amzing table ... This resin is awesome and clear please if u want a quality product with a company that stands behind its product this is the company not to mention the price is Fair. Lowest cost for amazing product never mind dont oder from here if u all do they might increase the cost lol
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Yellows in the sun
customer_reviews.text: This product started out great but it is not uv resistant. It has been outside for two weeks and has yellowed beyond the point of just looking bad and has entered the state of looking awful.
customer_reviews.author: brett

customer_reviews.title: Depends on what you are using it for.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to fill voids in a woodworking project. I used to be a professional furniture maker, and frequently used Envirotex Lite to fill voids in Mesquite (mixing it with a couple of drops of universal tint to turn it black). I bought this product to save some cash on a project for personal use. It cures faster and is a bit more brittle than Envirotex Lite. I imagine that your satisfaction will depend entirely on what you use it for, but if you are using it as I am, I highly recommend Envirotex Lite instead.
customer_reviews.author: Will P.

customer_reviews.title: dost waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this product on 4 or more separate occasions every time I have had problems with it I have used other epoxys before that have worked fine this is the only one that has given me a problem I finally decided to not use this 1 anymore and just spend extra money on the other brains
customer_reviews.author: Zac

customer_reviews.title: Nice clear epoxy
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful epoxy. Blends very well and dried nice and clear, with little to no air bubbles (I did blast it with my heat gun prior to application to pop bubbles). The only bad thing are the jugs are hard to pour, which I anticipated and purchased separate squeeze bottles for. I am very pleased and will definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: The instructions are available on the company's website and are good; follow them and expect to spend about twice ...
customer_reviews.text: Application went smoothly, but my first flood coat wasn't sufficient to flood completely over the sides so the edges will have to sanded and re-coated. So be aware that if it flows over the sides unevenly subsequent coats will not smooth that out on vertical surfaces. The instructions are available on the company's website and are good; follow them and expect to spend about twice as long stirring as they state. Can't speak yet as to how it holds up under use but it looks gorgeous. And although I read on the company site and elsewhere that one could use a hair dryer instead of torch to remove air bubbles, I found the hair dryer to be largely ineffective.
customer_reviews.author: mw

customer_reviews.title: Great, durable, clear finish.
customer_reviews.text: This product works wonderfully every time. I highly recommend investing is a decent pump system, which helps keep messes down, and also dispenses perfect 1” measurements, Also, invest in a high-numbered sandpaper, like 3000, and a polishing compound. This will allow you to buff out irregularities,,or to create a slightly matte finish. Great for tabletops, art projects, and framed art “glass”, thank you for the great product,
customer_reviews.author: Penny Row Design

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great....I was having an allergic reaction to another brand and had to stop using it.....went to pro Marine and I have used 2 gal and I have not had the first reaction......I still use gloves and a mask which you should always do when using epoxy....but I am working with it daily and having no allergic reaction to it at all....
customer_reviews.author: Sylck123

customer_reviews.title: Its yellow, glad I did a small test first
customer_reviews.text: Photo shows side by side comparison to another resin. I wanted to test before I did a coat on a table, glad I did. No ink or micas used on this, the wood was cured and already had resin seal on it before the pour, so I know it wasn't the wood that caused the yellowing. Cures fast so it gets really hot.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Dried rubbery
customer_reviews.text: I went through the whole gallon of this resin and i found it to be much less consistent than other brands. I’m not a pro with resin but I had many attempts to get this resin to dry properly and maybe 1 out of every 5 batches came out correctly. I poured the proper ratios and stirred for a very long time and still my products came out rubbery or sticky. Mostly the products were rubbery so I could bend them around long after they had dried. Maybe I just need more practice but I wasn’t impressed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Smith

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is great! But
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great! But, you need to be meticulous on how you apply it. They are not kidding when they say that the two need to be mixed thoroughly and to avoid scraping the sides or bottom. I did scrape the bottom for one small section of the table and, indeed, it did not completely harden and remained tacky. So I took their advice and got an artist brush and put another layer on the tacky section and it worked. It is beautiful. It is high gloss and some people don't like that but it is clear and the beauty of the wood shines through perfectly. Also, it is pretty messy so be prepared for that.
customer_reviews.author: Venture Technologist

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sealing countertop
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research, followed the instructions and watched DIY videos before using this to seal my painted kitchen counters. This was one of the only food grade epoxy resins I found and you can’t beat the price. You really need to work fast and from my experience, pour more thank you need rather than going back and pouring again as the same batch poured different times still causes visible ripples. But it really does a great job. Most importantly- home should be 75 degrees of more to support the hardening process and a torch helps get rid of bubbles. Don’t skimp on the torch.
customer_reviews.author: Squirrelhoarder

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to make a celestial "river" wood countertop for our bathroom since me and the fiance didn't want stone. The epoxy was perfect for the glow in the dark tinted powders and was easy to use. If you FOLLOW THE DIRECTIONS and take your time this works perfectly and turns out beautiful. I watched a few videos and this is our 1st attempt and we had little to no problems using this epoxy. Has a 1/4" for each layer guideline, and was more value than purchasing deep 2" pore epoxy...especially if you do different colored layers like we did. Even with strict measuring we ended up with more B than A. So don't be alarmed.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Beginner Proof Epoxy Resin
customer_reviews.text: Got a little carried away with adding some pebbles, so my first attempt was not what I'd hoped. The directions said to wait 4 - 10 hrs. between layers. My first layer was hard (could tap on it), in less than half an hour. But, after 4 pours, it was still doing good. It did cure hard, but, I think I should have used mold release as it did not separate from the mold. I'm a beginner. So, "If at first... try, try again. Small practice efforts might be a lot faster in curing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dimples
customer_reviews.text: I used this resin for about a year now, but suddenly with a batch I got I was having problems with fish eyes and dimples. I thought maybe it was my fault, but then I switched to another epoxy brand to test it out- no more problems. I used rat for awhile then tried this one again and had to deal with dimples AGAIN. Now that I’m going through the one star reviews I can see at least four other people with this same exact problem. So done.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn O'Dell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Too many negative reviews from novices that don't read or don't follow directions. I've used this on several large projects and have had amazing results and continued compliments. I'm in the process right now of making a triple river maple dining table and I expect the Pro Marine top clear coat to come out gorgeous. I'm confident I'll get $2500 for this table.
customer_reviews.author: bobo

customer_reviews.title: Super clear and amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product! We used this to as a clear coat for a countertop we refinished. Worked superbly and the shine is fantastic! Follow the instructions and be ready for a bit of a mess but otherwise it's easy to work with. I'm tempted to find more projects to use this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality, awesome price!
customer_reviews.text: So after ordering my 4th gallon I'm confident in leaving a review. Love this stuff. So long as you pre-warm the bottles prior to mixing it is a dream and it thins out nicely for pouring, bubbles are minimal and easily popped. You can get lovely lacing effects without any addatives with mica and alcohol ink pigments. I honestly feel this stuff is beginner friendly, excellent quality and a fraction of competitors prices.
customer_reviews.author: HarlequinMuse

customer_reviews.title: A Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This was the first time I used epoxy resin. I did so on a very old butcher block top that I'm using as an outside bar. The problem was with the bar itself and not the product. It was dried out to the point of some cracks forming between a few boards. I had used a marine spar varnish on it originally but it didn't seal it in the cracks well enough. I then tried the epoxy which covered the top beautifully but bubbles continued to slowly rise from cracks to the point where I couldn't burn them all. So I have some bubble blemishes to deal with. Learning experience. I really like the epoxy finish though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality epoxy resin for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: If you've got epoxy skills/knowledge, you will love this kit. The 1 to 1 mixing ratio makes things easy, and this stuff is rock solid once cured. Colors well and I'm a witness that you can pour as thick as you want AS LONG AS you pour in 1/8"-1/4" pours every 4 hours. Love this stuff, and for the price and quality, it's my current go-to epoxy resin.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service Came Through!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product and had an issue with the performance of the epoxy (Part A). The return window had expired but I contacted Amazon anyway since the product was defective. Amazon directed me to contact the manufacturer (ProMarine Supplies). I spoke with Monica at ProMarine, who maintained that Amazon would need to respond since they handled the fulfillment. Amazon again denied being able to assist. Monica stuck with it, providing me with an Amazon escalation phone number and also calling her Amazon contact as well. With her involvement, Amazon resolved my issue. Thanks very much to Monica - will be happy to purchase again. AND this is why I do business with Amazon, too!
customer_reviews.author: Broadway Bound

customer_reviews.title: Crystal clear
customer_reviews.text: First time ever using resin, poured on a wood piece I wood burned for a coworkers wedding. First coat brushed on for wood to soak up and then flood coat. It leveled out great with minimal amount running off the sides and 48 hrs after it looks like glass! Can't wait to do next project and will definitely order from again! Thank you for quick shipping!
customer_reviews.author: M.V.

customer_reviews.title: Great resin but be safe
customer_reviews.text: The first resin I’ve worked with. I’ve heard from other reviews it’s thicjer than others and not as watery. Although labeled as NO VOC I would still take precautions with it especially if you are torching it (to remove bubbles). There is a slight odor. My first use I did not wear a mask although I was in a well ventilated area. My lungs hurt/burned for a few days. I’ve taken a break and have since purchased a respirator with organic vapor cartridges for the next time. It does dry quickly and gives a beautiful, durable shine.
customer_reviews.author: Gringa Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: RUINED MY PROJECT! COST ME TIME & MONEY
customer_reviews.text: This product cost me a lot of time and money. I ensembles an entire peacock tail for a headboard, followed the directions (1st painted layer/2nd flood layer) and it never dried. It was in the beating CA sun (100 degrees/dry heat) for 3days straight before I brought it inside. The second day I noticed Epoxy in the floor... feels tacky in the “driest” corners. RUINED my project I spent so much on!
customer_reviews.author: Midori

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, way too many bubbles
customer_reviews.text: Did not like this resin at all. I have made several things now and the bubbles are impossible to get rid of. A heat gun does not work, it just moves them around and they sit at the top and edges. It looks very ugly because after demolding, the bubbles are all around the edges and top. It’s not as clear due to the bubbles and the smell is extremely strong. Unfortunately I bought the gallon kit and have to finish it but I will not be ordering this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Lilian

customer_reviews.title: I used this product today and it cured perfectly. ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this product today and it cured perfectly. The directions are very specific on how to combine, mix, and apply this product properly. I suspect the one star folks didn't bother going to the product web site and reading the directions on how to successfully use this stuff. It's tempting to wonder "how hard can it be to mix up and apply a 50/50 epoxy?". It turns out there are about five mistakes you can potentially make which will effect how the epoxy cures. Just follow the simple directions to the letter and you'll have outstanding results with this reasonably priced epoxy.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Not good for use with molds/crafts.....lots of bubbles
customer_reviews.text: I used this to make clear ashtrays. I've used several different kinds of epoxy since I started making my ashtrays, but because I cannot go to the store and buy it I Had to order through Amazon. This epoxy is very strong but takes a very long time to cure completely. It is definitely not scratch resistant! And there were so many bubbles... more bubbles and I've ever had with other brands since I started using epoxy resin. With a lot of time patience and skill I was able to get some usable pieces but I probably won't be buying this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: The Burleys

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I made a play table for my granddaughter and finished the top with a 'dirty' pour of epoxy resin from ProMarine. It was my first attempt at using epoxy resin, and the process was easier than I had expected. I found out that the epoxy should be warmed up before pouring; that makes to product level out easier. I was happy with the end result though and now I am looking forward to my next pour. To that end I bought another 2 gallons of epoxy resin from ProMarine supplies. The epoxy had set after 24 hours and after 3 days was ready for use. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Item was as described and arrived quickly. Loved the QR code on the bottle for directions. Directions were thorough and easy to understand. Product applied as described. I ended up with a few bubbles but that's because I didn't apply heat to release the air in time. Other buyers had great advice for application, so take the time to read those.
customer_reviews.author: SaltyChick

customer_reviews.title: Keep it at room temp.
customer_reviews.text: Tried it for my first epoxy project. Added color pigment. Part b was very cold on first try and didn't mix. Was very tacky after 3 days. Warmed up both to room temp and did second attempt. Much better. Going to coat the second one with a layer to make a cutting board if that's safe. Still trying to find out. I've asked, but had no contact. Either way, it seems good with a little practice.
customer_reviews.author: Anon.

customer_reviews.title: Works well albeit a few bubbles on the bottom side of a coaster pour
customer_reviews.text: I like this product and have used it for many art projects but even mixing enough for half a coaster I somehow get an ungodly amount of bubbles. I ensure to mix with a scale and slowly with a plastic tool but still happens every time. The majority pop out after a few passes of a heat gun but a few refuse to leave the bottom corner of the silicone.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew George

customer_reviews.title: never dried
customer_reviews.text: I'm so disappointed with this product, I followed the instructions exactly and large areas in the counter never dried. its been two weeks and is still sticky and because its outdoor all kinds of bugs are now stuck on it. I have 3 lizards stuck that I will have to scrape off. I was really looking forward to a nice glossy counter.
customer_reviews.author: tan

customer_reviews.title: My wife uses it for tumblers
customer_reviews.text: My wife uses these for tumblers. She said it is a little thicker, but works great. She has done a lot of research. She isn't usually a person who follows directions, but she has been perfecting her craft. As long as you do your research, and take your time, this stuff works great. I would also like to add buying the 1 gallon kit cost about half price in the long hall. Knowing this works, we will get the 2 gallon kit next, and save even more. ***note: have not tried on table tops yet, but will update feedback when we do.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen E. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The product is easy to handle IF you follow the instructions. Your project must be free of dirt or dust. Mixing thoroughly is very important. Have everything ready to start before mixing. Make sure you are in an even temperature environment that is above 70 degrees for drying. It takes a while to dry on the first coat so do not get inpatient. The second coat you pour on watch for air bubbles which you will need a blow torch or heat gun to get rid of the bubbles. It drys clear as glass. The product is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Crouch

customer_reviews.title: Excellent resin! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE ProMarine resin!! I have purchased probably 30 gallons (or more) over the past few years! I highly recommend it because of the easy mixing, self leveling and beautiful finish!! I have tried other brands a few times and I ALWAYS come back to ProMarine! I have recommended it to fellow resin artists and friends! I gave it five stars across the board! Four stars on durability, only because I need a higher heat resistance on the countertops I do. This is absolutely the way to go and I am a forever customer!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly H. Quinn

customer_reviews.title: River table pour
customer_reviews.text: I built a river table with this. It worked great but do small pours at about a half inch at a time. The chemical reaction gets it pretty hot but it never shrank or cracked.
customer_reviews.author: David Evans

customer_reviews.title: Adequate at best
customer_reviews.text: Product seems to be pretty thick when pouring out. I've used a couple different types of epoxy glaze over the years and this one just doesn't seem to pour/level out thin enough to not have to use a brush/sponge/squeegee. For the initial seal coat(s) it's great but the flood coat I ended up using my old tried and true epoxy. I even sat both bottles in hot water to loosen it up and when combined and mixed for 3-5 minutes I had the same effect. Will probably get through these bottles (only used for seal coats) then move on. I'm chalking this one up to an experimental usage.
customer_reviews.author: PBuck

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful bar top.
customer_reviews.text: I've waited awhile before reviewing. I wanted to see how well it held up over about 5 weeks. No problem with durability. Now using it... It's messy, messy and it's also messy. If you have ever used this type of product in the past you know there is no avoiding that. People have complained it's not working. It works BUT you MUST follow directions. If you don't read them ALL you can't possibly follow them. If you read them and follow them exactly it turns out great Update 10-15-2020...still good as day 1
customer_reviews.author: Me_So_Honey

customer_reviews.title: Great epoxy. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Safely packaged. On time. Great price. Easy mixing and handling. Nice and clear. Only time will tell how well it holds up against yellowing. I did not use mine outdoors but do have a test piece outside just cause I'm curious. Only reason for 4 stars is because the description leads one to believe it will not yellow in the sun. Which I highly doubt. Ive tried several UV epoxies and do far they just yellow at a different rate. I'll change it to 5 if it doesn't yellow after a month. I'll definitely play with this more and my go to we epoxy fir anything not requiring fiberglass laminating.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: this stuff worked great for making a table out of a log "cookie"
customer_reviews.text: found that it does not stick to the non-glue side of good quality duct tape, so everywhere it was in contact with the tape, it touched the non-glue side, with a second round of duct tape holding things in place. After a couple of days to dry (seemed to be dry in 24 hours but I gave it 72 to be sure), the holding tape pulled off (due to the non-glue side contact) and then finish the edges. One great thing is IF YOU DROP OR SCRATCH your surface, just light sand and put another coat on and the scratch goes away.
customer_reviews.author: Standard Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks good!
customer_reviews.text: Product is great in it's final form, but getting there is very difficult. When I decided to use this on my newly built Bar and Table, a total of 19 sq feet, I was told that a gallon would give me 1/4" coverage over 9 sq feet. 4 gallons later and we just ordered another half gallon. This stuff is not cheap! $62,95 a half gallon plus delivery. We also had problems with bubbles. If you use this product, make sure your wood surface is completely sealed before you apply. It is a good product, but buy a lot of it ad plan to work hard for the finish you want!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Faz

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I really like this epoxy, 1-to-1 mix that is easy to use. This brand came up in the top 10 for every different website I searched while researching epoxies for woodworking and I checked review sites for various industries (bar tops, boats, general woodworking, etc). I highly recommend this product, it made a clear table top with sparkles for my daughter's desk perfectly. FYI, if you use sparkles with the epoxy get the fine make up grade kind as it will not sink in the epoxy like most other types.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: product works, make sure you get the amount you ordered
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for a tabletop. The fill on the two " 1/2 gallon containers of epoxy ingredients was not the same. The resin weight was 1810 grams. The hardener weight was 1644 grams. When we mixed the two ingredients by weight measure ( the sellers instructions ) we only ended up with 108 oz of usable product, instead of 128 oz. A couple of ounces short I could understand but ending up with 81% of the advertised yield is not right. I have photo's of the weights on the scale and the volume measurements. I expect an adjustment as I only ended up with 108 oz. of usable mixture.
customer_reviews.author: Jack C

customer_reviews.title: Has it’s benefits and costs.
customer_reviews.text: There’s a learning curve with this resin. And all resin. Read the instructions! Benefits: easy to mix, cures hard, cures with few bubbles if mixed well & tricks/tips are used, cures without crazing generally, cures fast, low emissions if it’s not overheating, thick viscosity helps inclusions stay-put. Costs: pricy, overheats easily, sometimes cures too fast to work, prone to large bubbles more than some formulas, parts yellow in bottles if not used immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Dara C

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I used this to make a new tabletop to an old conference table that had seen years of abuse as a kids' art table. After I glued down my new designs, I coated a thick layer of this stuff and let it set. I didn't order enough, so I ended up using more from the local big box store. But this worked as advertised. I just wish that there was a way to polish this material back to its original shine. After some sanding of edges and drips, some of the areas are hazy. I used a variety of products to polish out the haze, eventually using Novus products to get the best results, yet still not crystal clear.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to stir for 5 minutes, hasn't cured yet 7 days later.....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to make a river table....Ha. Well its still flowing, literally. The material was SUPER viscus out of the bottle. I started by attempting to stir with a drill and mixing paddle....My drill started to over heat to I had to mix it by hand with an old wooden spoon. I'm a pretty strong guy so I gave it all I could until I was spent. I thought that must be enough. Well apparently it wasn't. It has been a week and it doesn't appear to have cured at all. This product was a total waste of money, and now some very expensive wood is ruined as well.
customer_reviews.author: lindsay

customer_reviews.title: decent for lathe work
customer_reviews.text: One of the parts is thicker than the other and can become a problem if you use it for casting. I use this stuff for projects that I later turn on a lathe and it has been working fairly well. When it heats up due to friction it will start to soften so you have to take it easy and maybe sprinkle a little water to cool it off. Also make sure to warm up the chemicals prior to mixing I would say around 75F-80F is a good range, this will thin out the epoxy and help it mix/pour.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Awesome to work with. You'll see on their instructions how their make of this epoxy is different, because it IS. I'm quite happy with it. In the winter, I kept a heat lamp on the bottles (I poured them into ketchup style squeeze bottles to make it easier) and let them get warm. Once they mixed and I stirred for a few minutes, it went quite well. They'll bubble up a little bit, but not bad if you keep the liquids warm. I've ordered this twice already and going for a third soon.
customer_reviews.author: dave

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Finished up a table with this stuff. It worked very well. My only gripe was that it requires you to keep everything above 75F or warmer throughout the entire process including the 75 hour curing process afterwards. In the summer, probably not a big deal, but it was a pain dealing with that in the winter. I had to do everything inside and I had too heat the entire house up and keep it there. That said, I came out with a nice finish minus a few fish eyes that were my fault for not getting all the grease off. Follow the directions and it will look awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jpederson

customer_reviews.title: Very messy but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: My Sealcoat I was worried about oh, because it looked blotchy and stuff was in it, from the brush and roller , I used to spread it. But the flood coat did cover all that up. But that epoxy flowed for about 2 hours I was cleaning edges and torching it every 10 minutes for about 2 hours. But really it turned out pretty good. They looks a little runny and places but overall it looks fantastic. Use a lot of cardboard to catch it and reapply it. I had it soak through masking paper. Which was a little disaster
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey W.

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised, very specific installation instructions, looks fantastic
customer_reviews.text: looks and works great, be sure not to underestimate how much you need - they have a website calculator USE IT ! follow the preparation instructions to the T, temperature is critical as is dust control as it takes a while to cure to the touch, buy some quality mixing cups - dont 1/2 @ss your measurements i will use this product again
customer_reviews.author: Zaphod Beeblebrox

customer_reviews.title: Does not dry
customer_reviews.text: I have tried 7 different projects with this and none of them have dried. I have done everything possible to get this to dry and it remains tacky. I have even placed it in direct sunlight to bake and it melted into a puddle instead of drying. I was on vacation when it arrived or I would have sent it back after the 1st project.
customer_reviews.author: Amy T.

customer_reviews.title: Very good results.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cover a dining room table. To practice I used it on a shop worktable. The results were so good that I don't want to use it as a workbench anymore. I did learn a lesson. Mix well. I didn't at first and ended up with sticky spots. I had to add more well mixed to correct the error.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Used to make resin bowls for lathing
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed the epoxy resin with wood chips to make resin/wood bowls that are then turned on the lathe. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Baker

customer_reviews.title: 5 star epoxy
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually giving this a 5 star. The reason why I gave it a one star is so you could not make the same mistake I made and these other one stars probably made. I'm making a bar table out of used bourbon barrels. On my first pour, bubbles kept coming no matter how much I used the her gun. What was happening was the wood was absorbing the epoxy and creating bubbles. So I recommend that you "seal" it first by painting a layer of epoxy and after that dries you can pour. The bubbles are not a flaw of the epoxy but most likely the material.
customer_reviews.author: david pace

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for a crystal clear, smooth surface
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to save a door with a safety glass panel. An accident caused the glass of a new door to shatter into thousands of pieces (like a car window), but thankfully they were held in place by a plastic film coating. I applied this tabletop finishing compound to both sides of the window and it now seems as strong as ever, but has some awesome character! This resin product mixes easily, but be warned, part A is VERY thick, and part B is quite runny, so be careful when pouring/measuring. When properly spread, the epoxy is nicely self leveling, and has very few bubbles that are easy to eliminate while the coating is still completely wet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great finish
customer_reviews.text: This product produces a beautiful and clear finish. The more coats, the thicker the finish. Directions are simple and if you follow them carefully you will end up with desired outcome. I advise preparing a place to do this and have all supplies handy because once you begin mixing you have limited time to apply. It's enough time but no dilly dallying...its also a bit messy, especially the first time you use it. All in all, love this product and will use again.
customer_reviews.author: Jill Shadid

customer_reviews.title: solid, worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: one of the cheapest i have seen listed on Amazon. mix as instructions direct, you won't be dissapointed. made an epoxy river table and matching benches for my first epoxy project. turned out pretty decent. also, if you plan on buying more than like 3 gallons, go to their website, they have great discounts for bulk purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Side Up

customer_reviews.title: Extremely difficult to mix and use, I would never buy this again !
customer_reviews.text: Worst product I have ever used and I’m experienced at epoxy. It totally ruined a $400 dollar project I had made and had to do it all over again! I don’t know why I ordered it a second time but then was so afraid to use it I bought different epoxy. I did try to mix it up in a small batch from the second order , carefully following directions and that batch turned out worse.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Southard Purdue

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! This is very easy to use. I think the newer labels on the bottles have instructions (mine did not). However, it’s almost fool-proof. Mix equal parts together, mix thoroughly until clear and spread. Use heat to eliminate bubbles. Leaves a beautiful, thick finish. Highly recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Otacon

customer_reviews.title: Bar Top Epoxy Resin makes professional looking project
customer_reviews.text: I was making a penny table with the Philadelphia Flyers (NHL) ice hockey logo. This is a picture after the seal coat was applied, I have 10 hours to make the first flood pour. I found Crystal Clear Bar Table Top Epoxy Resin easy to use with directions from their web site. I was happy to get directions for clean-up, I thought I would need to throw out the containers and stir stick. I bought plastic measuring containers at the dollar store.
customer_reviews.author: Deidre

customer_reviews.title: Horrible allergic reaction
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely do not recommend this product! I have been doing tumblers for awhile now. Ran out of my normal brand and heard mixed reviews of this. Now I am going on two weeks of an allergic reaction to it that NOTHING IS CLEARING UP. I always use PPE protection but somehow the fumes from this brand are just too strong, which really sucks because you can’t find a better bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Jenah

customer_reviews.title: Measurements are key to a great finish, and hardening.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product, just follow directions and your project will come out perfect. Make sure you put hardener in first as to coat the sides of the measurement cup, mix extremely well, air bubbles popped on there own w/o having to use a heat gun. I can highly recommend this for any type of project you want a hard shell finish on. Oh, and don't use a paint brush, use a sponge type with wood handle. ( Better quality than a plastic handle).
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Universal epoxy resin....
customer_reviews.text: I would say that this epoxy is universal. I've used it for molds, table tops, turning blanks, jewelry, wood finish, adhering things together, etc... I have never found a reason to look for another product. Really good quality epoxy resin at half the price of others. Very simple to use , just equal amounts of resin and hardener. Make sure that it is hot in the area that you are working in and you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: carl k.

product_meta.title: Crystal Clear Bar Table Top Epoxy Resin Coating for Wood Tabletop - 1 Gallon Kit

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
